prior_knowledge_digest: Students are expected to have a basic understanding of language learning concepts, such as vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure. They should be familiar with the idea of conjugating verbs and identifying parts of speech in English. This foundational knowledge will help them grasp the basics of Latin more easily.
yesterday_recap: N/A - This is the first day of the course.
misconception_watchlist: Confusing Latin word order with English
Assuming Latin pronunciation is the same as English
Overlooking noun cases and their functions

primary: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings
Explain the concept of noun cases

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the course objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and ask any initial questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone and encourage curiosity.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use the pronunciation guide to ensure accuracy.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings with the class.
lesson_flow.student_action: Engage in pair activities to practice greetings.

lesson_flow.description: Explain the concept of noun cases in Latin.
lesson_flow.student_action: Take notes and ask questions for clarification.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples to illustrate different cases.

lesson_flow.description: Review the day's key points and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in a brief Q&A session.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to reflect on what they learned.
